name: Allergic Eczema
Description: Allergic eczema is a form of eczema that occurs in response to contact with an allergen. An allergen isany substance to which a person may be allergic. It is commonly called contact dermatitis.
Symptoms: Itching, burning sensation or pain
Red bumps that may ooze, drain or crust
Redness and swelling in the affected area
Causes: Antibiotic creams or ointments that are used on the skin
Expose to nickel which can be found in jewelry, belt buckles, and metal buttons
Actions: Moisturize the skin daily with a fragrance-free moisturizer
Take oatmeal baths
Wear protective clothing and gloves when in contact
Remedies: It is always better to consult a doctor for medical advice

Remedies_list.title: OTC antihistamines
Remedies_list.description: Reduces or stops an allergic reaction.

Remedies_list.title: Topical antiseptic
Remedies_list.description: Destroys or prevents the growth of microorganisms on the skin that may cause infection.

name: Cellulitis
Description: Cellulitis is a common and sometimes painful bacterial skin infection. It may first appear as a red, swollen area that feels hot and tender to the touch. The redness and swelling can spread quickly.
Symptoms: Pain and tenderness in the affected area
Redness or inflammation of your skin
A skin sore or rash that grows quickly
Swollen skin with pus formation
Causes: Occurs when certain types of bacteria enter the skin through a cut or crack
Actions: Use mouth antibiotics for 6 to 12 days
Raise the affected area higher than your heart to reduce swelling
Remedies: It is always better to consult a doctor for medical advice

Remedies_list.title: Antibiotics
Remedies_list.description: Stops the growth of or kills bacteria.

name: Chickenpox
Description: Chickenpox is a very contagious infection caused by the varicella-zoster virus. It mainly affects kids, but adults can get it, too. The telltale sign of chickenpox is a super-itchy skin rash with red blisters. Over the course of several days, the blisters pop and start to leak. Then they crust and scab over before finally healing.
Symptoms: Red or pink bumps all over the body and filled with fluid that leaks
Fever, headache and loss of appetite
Causes: Chickenpox is highly contagious spreads through saliva, coughing, sneezing, and contact with fluid from the blisters
Actions: Take lukewarm baths
Wear soft, lightweight clothing
Apply topical ointments to help relieve itching
Remedies: It is always better to consult a doctor for medical advice

Remedies_list.title: Antiviral drug
Remedies_list.description: Reduces viruses' ability to replicate.

Remedies_list.title: Antihistamine
Remedies_list.description: Reduces or stops an allergic reaction.

Remedies_list.title: Analgesic
Remedies_list.description: Relieves pain.

name: Contact Dermatitis
Description: Contact dermatitis is a red, itchy rash caused by direct contact with a substance or an allergic reaction to it. The rash isn't contagious or life-threatening, but it can be very uncomfortable.
Symptoms: Forms dry, scaly, and flaky skin
Oozing blisters and skin redness
Skin burning sensations and sun sensitivity
Causes: Nickel or gold exposure to skin
Perfumes or chemicals in cosmetics and skin care products
Actions: Avoid scratching on the affected area
Clean the affected part of the skin with mild soap and lukewarm water
Use anti-itch treatments or petroleum jelly like Vaseline to soothe the area
Remedies: It is always better to consult a doctor for medical advice

Remedies_list.title: Antibiotics
Remedies_list.description: Stops the growth of or kills bacteria.

Remedies_list.title: Antifungal
Remedies_list.description: Kills or prevents growth of fungi.

name: Drug Allergy
Description: A drug allergy is an abnormal reaction of your immune system to a medication. Any medication — over-the-counter, prescription or herbal — is capable of inducing a drug allergy. However, a drug allergy is more likely with certain medications.
Symptoms: Forms skin rashes, hives and itching sensation
Runny nose and watery eyes
Mild fever, swelling and shortness of breath
Actions: Avoid or stop current medication
Seek form immediate medical care if symptoms worsen or multiple symptoms occur together
Remedies: It is always better to consult a doctor for medical advice

Remedies_list.title: Antihistamine
Remedies_list.description: Reduces or stops an allergic reaction.

name: Eczema
Description: Eczema is a condition that makes your skin red and itchy. It's common in children but can occur at any age. Atopic dermatitis is long lasting (chronic) and tends to flare periodically. It may be accompanied by asthma or hay fever.
Symptoms: Forms dryness, and scaly skin
Redness, itching which may be intense
Mild fever, swelling and shortness of breath
Actions: Apply cool compresses to the skin
Take colloidal oatmeal or baking soda bath
Never rub, after the bathe, gently lot the skin with soft towel
Wear loose-fitting clothes mode from soft fibers, like cotton
Remedies: It is always better to consult a doctor for medical advice

Remedies_list.title: OTC antihistamines
Remedies_list.description: Reduces or stops an allergic reaction.

name: Flea Bite
Description: A flea bite will appear as a tiny red bump surrounded by a small patch of inflamed skin. Bites will also tend to continue to occur during a home infestation.
Symptoms: Itching and pain sensation
Swelling around the affected area
Sometimes nausea, swelling of lips or face
Actions: Antihistamine medications
Avoid scratching
Wash the affected area of the bites with water and mild soap
If pet(s) at home, treat them
Remedies: It is always better to consult a doctor for medical advice

name: HFMD
Description: Hand-foot-and-mouth disease — a mild, contagious viral infection common in young children — is characterized by sores in the mouth and a rash on the hands and feet. Hand-foot-and-mouth disease is most commonly caused by a coxsackievirus.
Symptoms: General feeling of sickness
Sore throat or painful mouth sores
Runny nose
Poor appetite due to painful swallowing
Causes: Touch something that has been sneezed, coughed or drooled on
Touch body fluid from a draining sore
Actions: HFMD is mostly self-healing
Wash hands often with soap and water for at least 30 seconds
Clean and disinfect frequently touched surfaces and soiled items
Remedies: It is always better to consult a doctor for medical advice

Remedies_list.title: Analgesic
Remedies_list.description: Relieves pain.

Remedies_list.title: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug
Remedies_list.description: Relieves pain, decreases inflammation, and reduces fever.

name: Impetigo
Description: Impetigo is a common and contagious skin infection. Bacteria like Staphylococcus aureus or Streptococcus pyogenes infect the outer layers of skin, called the epidermis. The face, arms, and legs are most often affected.
Symptoms: Reddish sores on the skin
Clustered around the nose and lips
Ooze and burst and form a yellowish crust
Scores can be itchy and occasionally painful
Causes: Sunburn, other burns, or live in a warm, humid climate
Have skin conditions such as eczema, dermatitis or psoriasis
Have insect bites or poison ivy
Actions: Use antibiotic ointments or cream
Wash the affected area in warm water
Use clear wet compresses to help remove the scabs so the antibiotic can penetrate the skin
Remedies: It is always better to consult a doctor for medical advice

Remedies_list.title: Penicillin antibiotic
Remedies_list.description: Stops growth of or kills specific bacteria.

Remedies_list.title: Antibiotics
Remedies_list.description: Stops the growth of or kills bacteria.

name: Measles
Description: Measles is an infectious disease caused by a virus. It spreads easily from person to person. It causes a blotchy red rash. The rash often starts on the head and moves down the body.
Symptoms: Fever, coughing, runny nose, and even red eyes
Widespread skin rash all over body
White spots inside the mouth
Scores can be itchy and occasionally painful
Causes: Virus invasion, infects the respiratory tract first and eventually spreads to other parts of the body through the bloodstream
Actions: Measles vaccination
Rest to help boost the immune system
Supplements like vitamins and proteins
Remedies: It is always better to consult a doctor for medical advice

Remedies_list.title: Analgesic
Remedies_list.description: Relieves pain.

name: Melanoma
Description: Melanoma is a serious form of skin cancer that begins in cells known as melanocytes. While it is less common than basal cell carcinoma (BCC) and squamous cell carcinoma (SCC), melanoma is far more dangerous because of its ability to spread to other organs more rapidly if it is not treated at an early stage.
Symptoms: Skin sore that fails to heal
Spot or sore that becomes painful, itchy, or tender
Red lump that bleeds or looks ulcerated or crusty
Flat, red spot that is rough, dry or scaly
Actions: Contact an oncologist

name: Psoriasis
Description: Psoriasis is an immune-mediated disease that causes raised, red, scaly patches to appear on the skin. Psoriasis typically affects the outside of the elbows, knees or scalp, though it can appear on any location. Some people report that psoriasis is itchy, burns and stings.
Symptoms: Red itchy patches of skin
Scaly, or sometimes slivery patches
Joint swelling, stiffness, or pain is associated
Causes: Excessive smoking or/and heavy alcohol consumption
Actions: Applications of coal tar, either by cream, oil, or shampoo
Apply moisturizer
Remedies: It is always better to consult a doctor for medical advice

Remedies_list.title: Vitamin A derivative
Remedies_list.description: Unplugs blocked hair follicles and helps prevent new blockages from forming. Slows skin cell growth.

Remedies_list.title: Anti-inflammatory
Remedies_list.description: Prevents or counteracts swelling (inflammation) in joints and tissues.

name: Ringworm
Description: Ringworm is a common fungal skin infection otherwise known as tinea. Ringworm most commonly affects the skin on the body (tinea corporis), the scalp (tinea capitis), the feet (tinea pedis, or athlete's foot), or the groin (tinea cruris, or jock itch).
Symptoms: Red, itchy, or scaly patches
Patches that develop blisters or pustules
Patches that may be redder or resemble a ring shape
Causes: Human, soil, object, or animal contact
Actions: Wash beddings and clothes daily, especially during an infection
Dry thoroughly after bathing
Wear loose clothing in affected areas
Remedies: It is always better to consult a doctor for medical advice

Remedies_list.title: Antifungal
Remedies_list.description: Kills or prevents growth of fungi.

name: Rosacea
Description: Rosacea is a common skin condition that causes redness and visible blood vessels in your face. It may also produce small, red, pus-filled bumps. These signs and symptoms may flare up for weeks to months and then go away for a while.
Symptoms: Red, itchy, or scaly patches
Patches that develop blisters or pustules
Patches that may be redder or resemble a ring shape
Causes: Human, soil, object, or animal contact
Actions: Wash beddings and clothes daily, especially during an infection
Dry thoroughly after bathing
Wear loose clothing in affected areas
Remedies: It is always better to consult a doctor for medical advice

Remedies_list.title: Antibiotics
Remedies_list.description: Stops the growth of or kills bacteria.

Remedies_list.title: Vitamin A derivative
Remedies_list.description: Unplugs blocked hair follicles and helps prevent new blockages from forming. Slows skin cell growth.

name: Scabies
Description: Scabies is a skin infestation caused by a mite known as the Sarcoptes scabiei. Untreated, these microscopic mites can live on your skin for months. They reproduce on the surface of your skin and then burrow into it and lay eggs. This causes an itchy, red rash to form on the skin.
Symptoms: Intense itching that gets worse at night
Create scores that become infected
Pimple-like bumps
Actions: Topical medications to apply at night and washed off in the morning
Avoid crowded conditions
Remedies: It is always better to consult a doctor for medical advice

Remedies_list.title: Anti-parasite
Remedies_list.description: Kills parasites.

name: Scarlet Fever
Description: Scarlet fever is a disease which can occur as a result of a group A streptococcus (group A strep) infection, also known as Streptococcus pyogenes. The signs and symptoms include a sore throat, fever, headaches,  swollen lymph nodes, and a characteristic rash.
Symptoms: Red, sore throat with white or yellow patches
High fever, chills, headaches and swollen tonsils
Vomiting tendencies and nausea
Causes: Contagious disease, spreads from person to person via droplets expelled when an infected person coughs or sneezes
Actions: Wash hands before meals and after using restroom
Wash hands anytime after cough or sneeze
Reduce the share of utensils and drinking glasses with others
Drink warm teas or broth-based soups to help soothe the throat
Remedies: It is always better to consult a doctor for medical advice

Remedies_list.title: Penicillin antibiotic
Remedies_list.description: Stops growth of or kills specific bacteria.

Remedies_list.title: Analgesic
Remedies_list.description: Relieves pain.

name: Seborrhoeic Eczema
Symptoms: Red patches of skin
Flakes that may attach to the hair shaft
Itching sensation
Actions: Prescription-strength shampoos and ointments
Ranse the hair and scalp thoroughly
Remedies: It is always better to consult a doctor for medical advice

Remedies_list.title: Antifungal
Remedies_list.description: Kills or prevents growth of fungi.

Remedies_list.title: Antibiotics
Remedies_list.description: Stops the growth of or kills bacteria.

name: Shingles
Description: Shingles is a viral infection that results from the varicella-zoster virus (VZV), the same virus that causes chickenpox. It typically affects a single sensory nerve ganglion and the skin surface that the nerve supplies. Anyone who has had chickenpox can later develop shingles.
Symptoms: Early symptoms can be fever and general weakness
Pain, burning, or tingling sensation on the affected area
Fluid-filled blisters
Blisters sometimes erupt and ooze
Causes: Shingles is caused by virus, like chickenpox
Actions: Shingles vaccination
Remedies: It is always better to consult a doctor for medical advice

Remedies_list.title: Antiviral drug
Remedies_list.description: Reduces viruses' ability to replicate.

Remedies_list.title: Anesthetic
Remedies_list.description: Blocks pain at and near the site where it's given, or along the nerve that's blocked.

Remedies_list.title: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug
Remedies_list.description: Relieves pain, decreases inflammation, and reduces fever.

name: SLE
Description: Systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) is an autoimmune disease. In this disease, the immune system of the body mistakenly attacks healthy tissue. It can affect the skin, joints, kidneys, brain, and other organs.
Symptoms: Severe fatigue, joint pains, joint swelling, and headaches
Hair loss and blood-clotting problems
Rashes around cheeks and nose
Actions: Anti-inflammatory medications for joint pain and stiffness
Steroid creams for rashes
Remedies: It is always better to consult a doctor for medical advice

Remedies_list.title: Immunosuppressive drug
Remedies_list.description: Reduces immune response.

Remedies_list.title: Steroid
Remedies_list.description: Modifies or simulates hormone effects, often to reduce inflammation or for tissue growth and repair.

name: Tick Bite
Description: Ticks are small, blood-sucking bugs. They can range in size from as small as a pin’s head to as large as a pencil eraser. Ticks have eight legs. They’re arachnids, which means they’re related to spiders. Ticks prefer warm, moist areas of the body. Once a tick gets on your body, they’re likely to migrate to your armpits, groin, or hair. When they’re in a desirable spot, they bite into your skin and begin drawing blood.
Symptoms: Pain or swelling at the bite site
Redden rash with burning sensation
Difficulty breathing, if severe
Actions: Grasp the tick as close as possible and pull straight up and away from the skin
Clean the bite with soap and water
See a doctor to find out if any treatment is necessary (Lyme disease)
Remedies: It is always better to consult a doctor for medical advice

Remedies_list.title: Antibiotics
Remedies_list.description: Stops the growth of or kills bacteria.

Remedies_list.title: Penicillin antibiotic
Remedies_list.description: Stops growth of or kills specific bacteria.

Remedies_list.title: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug
Remedies_list.description: Relieves pain, decreases inflammation, and reduces fever.
